wikipedia_page.main:
John Whitfield (21 March 1957 – 4 November 2019) was a British musician and conductor from Darlington, England.
Whitfield was educated at Leighton Park School, Reading followed by Chetham's School of Music, Manchester and Keble College, Oxford. 
Contemporaneously he was principal bassoon of National Youth Orchestra (GB) and European Community (now Union) Youth Orchestra, EUYO. He was awarded Associate of the Royal College of Music with honours at just 17 and an MA in music from Oxford University.

response: Les Illuminations has been frequently recorded. Among the tenor versions is a 1963 set by Pears and the composer with the English Chamber Orchestra."Serenade; Les illuminations; Nocturne", WorldCat, accessed 13 October 2014 Soprano versions include those by Jill Gomez and John Whitfield with the Endymion Ensemble (recorded 1987) and Felicity Lott and Steuart Bedford with the English Chamber Orchestra (recorded 1994)."Phaedra; Five French folksong arrangements; Les illuminations" and "Illuminations (Les) / Our Hunting Fathers / Chansons Françaises", World Cat, accessed 13 October 2014

One of the founding members was John Whitfield who often conducted the group. Players have included pianist Michael Dussek, oboists Melinda Maxwell and Quentin Poole, clarinetist Mark van de Wiel, hornist Stephen Stirling and double bass player Chi-chi Nwanoku.
